intro: Ochrocarpos sanguineus, commonly known as the red-stemmed broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are small, pink to red, arranged in dense clusters. Ochrocarpos sanguineus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
